c74object.name: el.squash~
c74object.digest: A compressor for people who like overkill :)
c74object.description:
el.squash~ is based on a compression algorithm by Christopher Penrose. It can be useful for extreme effects, and is notable for employing the overlap-add system found in FFTease externals, though all processing is done in the time domain here.
This processor is capable of generating extreme frequency ranges. Use with caution, with a low playback gain, and do not use this external in performance until you are very familiar with its operation.

method.name: nmult
method.description: nmult is the multiplier when the ratio is less than 1 and the input signal RMS falls below the threshold nt. The value of nmult is 0.1 by default.

method.name: nt
method.description: The noise floor. By default this value is 0.0000001.

method.name: ratio
method.description: This value controls compression. Somewhat unintuitively, lower values give higher compression and vice-versa. The default value is 1.0 (no compression).

method.name: thresh
method.description: The threshold for compression. By default this value is 0.1.
